lines.line: Hey, how's it going?
Not good at all my friend. It's Elena, she's been taken...
Taken? By who?
The Knights of Ardougne. They claimed she was inciting rebellion against the king. Apparently she's been going around telling people that the plague isn't real...
Oh dear... This is a problem.
Is there anything you can do to help us? It feels wrong to ask given what you've done for us before, but we're desperate.
I'm sure this is all just a misunderstanding. Let me try talking to the king.
Thank you friend.
I can't help I'm afraid.
Edmond tells me you're helping Elena again. Thank you so much.
It's not a problem.
Good day my lord.
Hello. What can I do for you?
I'm here to talk about Elena, apparently she's been imprisoned.
That she has. She was making some heinous accusations.
That the plague is fake?
Exactly.
Right... But you and I both know that she's right, the plague is fake.
That's not the point. As I've explained to you before, the plague is a necessary evil. We can't have her exposing the truth and risking everything.
But King Tyras is dead, what exactly are we risking?
My brother may be dead but the Dark Lord is still a threat. Until that threat is gone, the plague must remain.
So you won't free Elena?
No. I can't take any risks. Now I'm afraid I have business to attend to. You should be on your way.
I see. I guess I should let her father know.
Hello. What can I do for you.
About Elena...
We've been through this already. I will not have the girl freed. She is a threat to Ardougne and will remain imprisoned.
Sorry citizen. Only Knights of Ardougne are allowed in the prison.
Good day.
Hello there citizen. What can I do for you?
What's down these stairs?
These stairs lead to the Ardougne Prison. It's home to thieves, murderers and everything in between.
Sounds lovely. Can I go in?
I'm afraid not citizen. Only the Knights of Ardougne are allowed into the prison and I can see that you are no knight.
Hello there. Have you spoken to the king yet?
I have.
And?
He won't be freeing her I'm afraid.
But why? I know all this plague business has got her a bit emotional, but can't he see that she's just upset?
He said she was a threat to Ardougne.
A threat? But she's no danger to anyone. Why does he think that way?
Well the thing is...
What?
Well... She's right. The plague is a lie. That's why the king had her imprisoned. He was afraid she'd expose the truth.
The plague is a lie? What do you mean the plague is a lie?
I guess I have some explaining to do.
You most certainly do.
Well, it all started after I freed Elena from West Ardougne. As you can imagine, she was still keen on helping the plague victims and asked me to help her find a cure.
We sent some samples to her old teacher, Guidor in Varrock. He ran some tests and found out that the plague isn't actually real. I confronted the king on this and he admitted it.
But why?
The king told me that his brother, King Tyras, was corrupted by the Dark Lord while exploring the lands to the west.
As Tyras was the king of West Ardougne, King Lathas decided to cordon the city off to keep the rest of the world safe.
The plague was the excuse he gave for the quarantine.
But that doesn't make any sense. Why not just tell the truth? Why lie to everyone and make up a plague? Something doesn't seem right about it all.
Well you're right about that. Turns out King Lathas was lying about that as well. But I'll get to that in a minute.
After confronting the king, he recruited me and tasked me with helping him stop Tyras. He had me travel through the Underground Pass into the elven forests of Tirannwn.
Elves? I wasn't even sure they existed anymore.
Well Tirannwn is full of them. In fact, they're currently in the middle of a civil war.
An elven civil war? I'm going to need a drink after all of this. So what happened next?
I met with an ally of King Lathas, an elf called Lord Iorwerth. He's the leader of one of the elven factions. With his help, I was successful in assassinating King Tyras.
With the job done, I returned to Ardougne. However, on my way back, I was intercepted by an elf named Arianwyn, the leader of the rebel elves opposing Lord Iorwerth.
He revealed the truth to me, that King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth are in fact the evil ones. Together they intend to summon this Dark Lord.
Just when I thought this story couldn't get any worse. The king is evil? Why?
From what I can tell, King Lathas hated how his father split the kingdom, giving half to him and half to his brother. He wanted his brother dead from the start.
Not only that, he also wants to reclaim Camelot from King Arthur. I think he's hoping that this Dark Lord will help him.
All of this, just because Lathas wants more land? What about this Lord Iorwerth, what's in it for him?
I think he wants to use the Dark Lord to defeat the rebel elves and end the civil war. Apparently, it's been going on for hundreds of years.
I see, this still doesn't explain why the plague was made up though.
Well since I learnt the truth, I've been helping the rebel elves fight back against King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth.
I recently discovered that Lord Iorwerth believes the secrets to summoning the Dark Lord lie within the Temple of Light beneath Ardougne.
The plague was made up to hide their mining operation beneath the city.
All the mourners are actually Iorwerth elves in disguise and the people who they claim have died of the plague are actually getting sent into the mines.
Goodness me Elena, what have you gotten yourself into?
Thank you for telling me the truth. I just wish you had told me sooner.
If even half of what you say about King Lathas is true, then my daughter is in great danger. We need to help her.
Do you have something in mind?
I do. They're holding Elena in the city prison beneath the castle. You'll need to disguise yourself as a Knight of Ardougne, infiltrate the prison and find a way to free her.
Why me?
As much as I hate to admit it, I'm far too old to pass as a knight. It will have to be you.
How do I get this disguise?
You'll need to get a steel platebody, some steel platelegs and a steel full helm. The plume on the helm will need dying red and you'll need a tabard for the platebody.
My wife should be able to help you with the tabard. You'll have to check with her to see what she needs for it. Come back to me once you have everything and we'll discuss what to do next.
What should I be doing?

You need to disguise yourself as a Knight of Ardougne. Get yourself a steel platebody, some steel platelegs and a steel full helm. The plume on the helm will need dying red and you'll need a tabard for the platebody.
It's not a problem. Do you think you could give me a hand with something?
What do you need?
I need to make a Knight of Ardougne tabard.
Hmmm, well that shouldn't be too hard for me to do. Could you bring me some silk and some purple dye please?
Luckily for us, I have them both right here.
Hmm, that is lucky.
Here you go.
Here you go, one tabard.
You can't have them.
Well I can't make your tabard then.
Will do.
Hello there. Do you have the silk and purple dye yet?
Not yet. I'll go and get them.
I do indeed.
Thank you so much for helping Elena. It means so much to Edmond and I.
I've finished the disguise.
Well you definitely look the part. Those guards will be totally fooled. Now get yourself down to the prison and see if you can find a way to free Elena. You'll find it beneath the castle.
Excellent, let's have a look at it.
Yes, this should be perfect. Those guards will be totally fooled. Now get yourself down to the prison and see if you can find a way to free Elena. You'll find it beneath the castle.
Yes, this should be perfect. Those platelegs are a bit dirty though, let me give them a polish for you.
There you go. Now get yourself down to the prison and see if you can find a way to free Elena. You'll find it beneath the castle.
Take your disguise and head down to the prison to see what you can find out. You'll find it beneath the castle.
Hello there fellow knight. Isn't today a wonderful day to be a Knight of Ardougne?

I mean it's okay I suppose. The constant fear of some random adventurer murdering you and the fact that people are constantly picking your pockets isn't great. But hey ho, at least the benefits are good.
That they are fellow knight, that they are.
Anyway, can I go down these stairs?
Of course you can! You're a Knight of Ardougne! There is no place where you can't go.
Yeah... Thanks.
Hey you!
Who are you?
Huh...
You don't look much like a.
What are you doing here... ?
Just here on guard duty.
Hmm... Very well. As you were......
Good to see you.
Who's ?
You are?
Ah yes, I am.
Hmm... Is your head working okay today ?
Of course, my head has never been better.
If you say so...
What do you want?
Elena it's me,.
? What are you doing here?
Rescuing you of course. Your father told me you were here.
Oh thank goodness. It's awful in here. The smell from that mugger...
So what happened Elena? How did you end up here?
Oh it's quite the tale, but let's save it for until I'm out of here. What's your plan?
Well I err... I don't really have one.
You don't have a plan? But aren't you meant to be an adventurer? How do you normally do this sort of thing?
To be honest, I usually just make it up as I go along.

Well luckily for us I have something in mind myself. There's an iron grate at the back of this cell that looks like it leads into the sewers. If I had some sulphuric acid, I could melt through it and escape.
But where do we get the sulphuric acid?
Thankfully it's pretty much essential in my line of work. I have some at my home, opposite my parents' house. You'll need to get it from my cabinet and bring it here. It's the thick clear liquid.
Okay, I'll be back soon.
It's okay Elena, it's me again.
Ah, thank goodness. How's it going?
What do I need to do again?
Go to the cabinet in my home, opposite my parents' house. Find some sulphuric acid and bring it back here. It's the thick clear liquid.
Now what did Elena say it looked like?
Is this what you needed?
No that's not right at all. You need some sulphuric acid. It's the thick clear liquid.
Sorry, I'll try again.
Yes that's it! Hand it over please.
Right, probably best you're not here when I escape. You should head back to my father.
Will do. Good luck Elena. I'll see you soon.
No.
Now's not the time for games !
Good news Edmond, Elena is free.
I know, she already came by to let us know. Thank you so much for your help.
Where is she now?
She's had to go into hiding to avoid recapture. She asked me to pass on the location though. It's the Rehnison household in West Ardougne.
Thanks Edmond. I'll go and see how she's doing.
Hello there friend.
Hi Edmond. Do you know where Elena is?
She's had to go into hiding to avoid recapture. She's hiding out at the Rehnison household in West Ardougne.
Hello. I'm afraid I can't talk right now. There's an issue with an escaped prisoner that I need to deal with.
Elena's come to visit! Elena's come to visit!
I heard. Do you know where she is?
She said she had some top secret work to do. Mummy and daddy will know.
Good day friend.
Hello. I'm looking for Elena.
Ah yes she said you'd be coming. They're all downstairs. The trapdoor is hidden under the bed.
They?
You mean you don't know? The resistance of course! You'd better head down, Elena will fill you in.
Good day friend.
Hello. Could you remind me where Elena is?
She's downstairs. The trapdoor is hidden under the bed.
Elena! It's good to see you safe.
And you. Thank you so much for helping to get me out of there.
Well I couldn't just leave you to rot. I care about you, Elena.
I care about you as well,. Thank you for not forgetting about me.
It's all in a day's work.
So what's going on Elena? Why are all these people here?
This, is the Ardougne Resistance!
The Ardougne Resistance?
Yes! It all started when you told me the truth about the king. I realised that it would take more than just us two to overthrow him, so I started to find allies for us.
I see, when were you planning on telling me?
Well I knew you were busy infiltrating the mourners so I didn't want to trouble you until we were all set up. We're just about there now though.
So is this how you ended up in that prison?

It is. It happened while I was trying to gather more support for us. I was trying to convince some people of the truth behind the plague, but they didn't believe me. They reported me and I was arrested not long after.
Well you've clearly been quite busy. I've also made some progress since we last spoke.
With the mourners? What did you find out?
The mourners have been searching for a temple under West Ardougne. There's an altar there that they want to use to summon the Dark Lord.
That doesn't sound good at all.
Don't worry, I restored the safeguards on the temple so they shouldn't be able to get in.
Ah, that's good to hear. Do you think we're safe now?
For now, but we can't rule out King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth finding another way.
Well we can't do anything about Lord Iorwerth, your elf friends will have to sort him out. But if we get our way, Lathas might not be king for much longer.
So what's your plan?
You've met Councillor Halgrive before, right? He's been helping us put a plan together.
Good to see you. Allow me to run you through what we have so far.
So unluckily for us, the king has total control over the Paladins and the Knights of Ardougne. With them, he has a large army at his disposal, one we cannot hope to stand against.
But you're a councillor, can't you do anything about that?
The council serves the king I'm afraid, we can't overrule his decisions. Nor can we take power from him. What we can do however, is step in if the king becomes unfit for rule.
But the king is a traitor, surely that's enough reason.
It is, but right now it's our word against his. And as you've already seen with Elena, he is keen to keep us silent.
Before I was arrested, we'd hoped to gather enough support among the people to be able to peacefully remove the king from power. Sadly, we've not been able to convince many of them.
It's no surprise, really. The king has created a clever lie with the plague, one that's easy for people to believe.
Councillor Halgrive has come up with an alternative way to gather support. I can't pretend I totally approve of it, but it seems to be our only option.
We need people to see the king for what he really is. They're clearly not going to believe us when it comes to the plague, so we'll have to resort to some dirtier tactics.
When Elena told me about how you freed her from the prison, it gave me an idea...
With your disguise, you can appear to be working directly for the king. Any actions you perform in that disguise will seem like they were ordered by him.
I see where this is going. If I upset people while dressed as a Knight of Ardougne, they'll blame the king.
And once they are upset, they'll be far more likely to believe what we have to say.
You can probably see why I'm not a fan now. If we're to remove the king, it should mark a new start for Ardougne. But if that's all built on a lie, are we any better than the king himself?
I agree, this is a dangerous path to follow.
It is, and yet it seems to be the only path open to us. I fear the danger of inaction could harm the people far more than a few small lies.
It's not good, but it might be our only option.
I agree. I fear the danger of inaction could harm the people far more than a few small lies.
Who cares, it's for the good of the people.
But who are we to decide that?
There is no perfect answer here. However, I fear the danger of inaction could harm the people far more than a few small lies.
You're right, it just makes me feel uncomfortable, all of this.
So, are you willing to help us?
I am.
Excellent, let's get to work then. Wear your Knight of Ardougne disguise and use it to turn people against the king in East Ardougne.
You'll want to build support in West Ardougne as well but the knights aren't allowed here. You can use your mourner disguise instead though.
As you turn people against the king, we'll be on hand to convince them of our cause. If we aim to recruit 80 people from across both parts of Ardougne, we should have quite the army.
What sort of things should I do?
Anything that upsets people really. I suspect some of the others here will have a few suggestions for you. Just keep an eye out for suitable opportunities.
I'll keep track of how many people we've recruited, just let me know if you need an update.
Right, I'd better get started then.
Good luck.
I need to think about this.
Of course, it is a big ask. We'll be here once you have decided.
You'd better speak to Elena, she'll fill you in on what's happening here.
We need to recruit people into our resistance so that we can overthrow the king. Elena can tell you how many people we've recruited.
Your role in this is to increase hatred for the king amongst the people. That will allow us to recruit them to our cause.
Disguise yourself appropriately and perform any actions that cause upset with the citizens. With your disguise, people will think you are acting on the orders of the king.
For East Ardougne, you'll need a Knight of Ardougne disguise. For West Ardougne, you'll want a mourner disguise.
If you need any suggestions on what to do, ask the others here and see if they have anything for you.
Okay, thanks for the help.
Hey. We haven't recruited anyone into the resistance yet. You should speak to the others if you need help getting started.
Hey. We've recruited people into the resistance so far. We still need more.
Hey there. Do you have any suggestions for this uprising of ours?
I bet people would get pretty angry if they had their food taken away. You could burn the food stores in West Ardougne and claim it's to protect people from the plague.
Won't people be willing to accept that though if they think it's preventing the plague spreading?
Some will, but don't forget that it was the authorities that supplied the food in the first place. People will soon get angry if they think that not enough care is being taken with the food.
Ahh I see, that does make sense. I wonder if I can do something similar in East Ardougne as well.
Hey Jethick, got any ideas on how to increase hatred for the king?
An increase in taxes would definitely cause some anger, especially if it seems that the king is making personal gain. No one likes the idea of the rich getting richer.
Good thinking, what's the best way to spread that sort of news?
You could target the citizens themselves but that would be slow going. I'd recommend going for shopkeepers instead, that will impact more people in less time.
Great, thanks for the help.
Hey, do you two know of any ways I can cause anger at the king?
We did have an idea. With the plague, lots of people are worried for their health. We could take advantage of that.
There's not many doctors and nurses around here. You've got Nurse Sarah in West Ardougne and Doctor Orbon in East Ardougne but that's about it.
Imagine if the king made a new law stating that all doctors and nurses in Ardougne had to retrain. They'd be out of action for months.
People wouldn't like that at all, thanks both.
I'm here to tell you about some new taxes.
Taxes? Look at this place, do you think I can afford to pay any taxes?
Fighting the plague isn't cheap, the money needs to come from somewhere.
As if life in this city couldn't get any worse. Where am I going to find the money?
That's for you to work out. The first payment is to be collected soon.
A knight wouldn't be telling me this, they're not allowed in West Ardougne. I don't know who you really are, but you should leave.
I should probably wear my mourner disguise before doing that.
Citizens don't decide new taxes. You should leave.
What are you doing? The people need that food!
Sorry, but we have reason to believe the food is contaminated. This is for the good of everyone.
But people will starve!
I'm just doing my job. You should take it up with the king if you don't like it.
I have some orders from the king for you.
Orders?
Yes. The king is concerned about the plague spreading into East Ardougne. He has ordered that all doctors and nurses retrain to ensure they are capable of dealing with the plague.
But I don't have time to retrain! The people here need me! Who will help them if I'm gone?
I'm sure the king considered all of that before making his decision.
Well he may be king but he clearly doesn't have a clue about health. This could be disasterous for the city!
You knights aren't allowed in West Ardougne. You should leave.
I don't take orders from citizens. Now I have work to be doing.
You're burning the food! We need that food!
We believe the food is contaminated with the plague. This is for your own safety.
We'll starve without it though! You can't do this!
I already have.
I'll make sure everyone hears about this!
Good day. What can I get you?
New taxes? What are you talking about?
The plague isn't easy to contain. New funds are needed to help the effort.
But I barely make any money here. I can't afford to pay new taxes.
Sorry, but the king himself gave the order. The first payment is due soon.
The people won't allow this to continue!
Hang on, I know you knights aren't allowed in West Ardougne. You're an imposter! Get out!
And why would a citizen be the one telling me this? Don't waste my time.
What do you think you're doing?
The king has ordered us to burn this food. It could be contaminated with the plague.
But that food is for the people. Without it they will starve!
Sorry, just doing my job.
A lot of people are going to be angry about this!
I buy silk. If you ever want to sell any silk, bring it here.
New taxes? What new taxes?
Taxes on all market stalls. The order comes from the king himself.
Well I'll need to up my prices. A lot of people won't be happy about this.
Probably not, but they'll just have to live with it. These taxes are needed for the good of the city. Someone will come to collect the tax from you soon.
The king wouldn't send a mourner to tell me this. Go away!
The king wouldn't send a citizen to tell me this. Go away!
Good day. Would you like some nice freshly baked bread? Or perhaps a nice piece of cake?
What are you on about? New taxes?
The plague isn't cheap to combat. The king has decreed that new taxes be introduced to help with the funding.
I appreciate the need to combat the plague but this is a foolish move. My food feeds a lot of people, they'll be furious to hear about this.
Better than getting the plague though. Your first payment is due soon, so you'd better be ready.
You mourners may deal with the plague, but I know you have nothing to do with taxes. Now leave me alone!
Citizens have nothing to do with taxes. Leave me alone!
New taxes? What new taxes?
The king has ordered that new taxes be introduced to help fund the fight against the plague.
The food I provide helps to feed this city! People won't be happy when I have to increase my prices!
Sorry, it's needed though. The first payment is due soon, make sure you're ready.
Just because you mourners handle the plague doesn't mean you get to make new taxes. Go away!
Citizens don't deal with taxes. Go away!
Silver! Silver! Best prices for buying and selling in all Kandarin!
New taxes? What are you on about?
The king has called for a tax on luxury items. Your stall is included.
Well that is unacceptable! I will have to increase my prices. I've produced silver for the king himself before but don't expect me to do that again!
As you wish, but you'll still need to pay. Your first instalment will be collected soon.
The king wouldn't send a mourner to tell me this. Clear off!
The king wouldn't send a citizen to tell me this. Clear off!
Here, look at my lovely gems.
What new taxes?
The king has called for a tax on luxury items like the ones you sell.
But the king is one of my biggest customers! I hope he realises that I'll have to increase my prices and he won't be exempt from that!
I'm sure the king has good reason. I will return to collect your first payment soon.
I don't think the king would send a mourner to tell me this. Go away!
I don't think the king would send a citizen to tell me this. Go away!
Would you like to trade in fur?
What new taxes?
By order of the king, all market stalls are to be taxed to help fund his new castle market.
His new castle market? So he's taxing us to help him set up a competing market? This is outrageous!
Well he's the king so he can do what he wants. Your first payment will be collected soon.
And he sent a mourner to inform us? Go away!
And he sent a citizen to inform us? Go away!
Are you interested in buying or selling spice?
What are you on about?
Taxes on all market stalls. It's to help fund a new market at the castle.
A new market could put me out of business! Why should I help fund it?
Because it's the law, refusing to pay is treason. Your first payment is due soon, so I suggest you prepare for it.
I will make sure the people hear about this!
A mourner wouldn't be sent to tell me this. Go away!
A citizen wouldn't be sent to tell me this. Go away!
Hear ye! Hear ye! Player Moderators massive help to RuneSc-
Oh, hello citizen. Are you here to find out about Player Moderators? Or perhaps would you like to know about the laws of the land?
Could you help me tell people about some new taxes?
New taxes? You know that people won't be happy about that, right?
I know, it's the king's orders though. The castle is in need of repairs and more funds are required.
As you wish, I will make sure the people know. Just know that I'll be sending them right to the king if they get angry.
New taxes? I know that mourners don't have anything to do with taxes. Please allow me to get on with my work.
New taxes? A citizen wouldn't have anything to do with taxes. Please allow me to get on with my work.
Hello there! I sell plate mail bodies, are you interested?
I'm already paying my taxes though?
These are new ones. They are to help pay for the king's upcoming visit to Great Kourend.
Well I don't see why I have to pay for that! If the king can't afford the trip, then maybe he shouldn't be going!
It's an important diplomatic trip I'm afraid so it has to go ahead. The first payment will be collected soon.
And he's getting a mourner to tell me this? Nice try.
And he's getting a citizen to tell me this? Nice try.
Hello. Welcome to the Gielinor Housing Agency! What can I do for you?
But the Gielinor Housing Agency doesn't pay taxes here! It's part of our business agreement with the king!
These taxes are not included in that agreement. They're new emergency taxes related to the plague.
Well this is just no good. If the king does not intend to honour his arrangement with us, we may well take our business elsewhere!
You can do that, but while you're in Ardougne you must pay the tax. The first payment will be due soon.
And a mourner is the one telling me this. I don't think so.
And a citizen is the one telling me this. I don't think so.
Welcome to the pet insurance bureau. How can I help you?
What are you on about? I already pay my taxes.
The king has ordered some new taxes to help fund his extensive collection of gnomish ornaments. Everyone has to contribute.
Gnomish ornaments? Why can't the king pay for his own ornaments? He's got enough money as it is!
The law has already been passed so it's not up for debate. Your first payment is expected soon.
I'll make sure people hear about this!
And why would he send a mourner to tell me this? Stop lying and get out!
And why would he send some random citizen to tell me this? Stop lying and get out!
Hello there. You've come to the right place if you're looking for adventurer's equipment.
New taxes? What new taxes?
The castle is in dire need of repairs, the taxes are to help fund that. They've been ordered by the king himself.
Ordered by the king? This is preposterous! We'll have to increase our prices to afford this, people will be furious!
Sorry, but rules are rules. The first payment is due soon so make sure you're ready.
Ordered by the king? What a load of rubbish! You mourners seem to think you own the place. Well you don't! Now clear off!
Ordered by the king? What a load of rubbish! I can see you're not one of his people. Stop fooling around and get lost!
Peace be with you, friend.
Taxes? But this is a holy church of Saradomin, we are exempt from taxes.
More funding is needed to hold back the plague. The church needs to help as well.
We'll need to use the donations from the congregation. We were hoping to use that money to build an orphanage for those who lost their parents to the plague.
Sorry, but the king has given the order. The first payment is due soon.
It is not the job of a mourner to deal with taxes. Now, if there's nothing else, I must get to work.
It is not the job of a citizen to deal with taxes. Now, if there's nothing else, I must get to work.
Hello there. Can't stop to talk I'm afraid, I'm very busy right now.
What are you on about?
The king is concerned about the plague spreading. He has ordered that all doctors and nurses in the city retrain to ensure they are capable of dealing with the plague.
Retrain? But that will take months! Who will help the people if there are no doctors around? This is a foolish move!
Well the king's word is law so there's little point arguing.
Well don't blame me when there's no one to help the king if he falls ill!
I don't take orders from citizens. Now I really must get to work.
Would you like to buy a drink?
Taxes? What do you mean?
By order of the king, all establishments such as this must now pay an extra beer tax.
Beer tax? My patrons work hard for the city of Ardougne! They come here to unwind after a long day. This is plain disrespect to the work they do!
It's also plain disrespect to defy the king's laws so you'd better be ready to pay up. We'll be back to collect soon.
You haven't heard the last of this!
And why would a mourner be telling me this? Clear off!
You don't represent the king! Clear off!
New taxes? What for?
The king has ordered an increase in taxes on all farms in the area. It's due to a lack of care when it comes to the plague.
Lack of care? This is about Farmer Brumty and his sheep isn't it? That has nothing to do with us here! Why should we pay for his mistakes?
Sorry, it's the word of the king so you'll have to pay up. The first instalment will be collected soon.
You mourners may serve the king, but you don't have the power to enforce that. Go away!
You don't have the power to enforce that. Go away!
New taxes?
Yes, they've been ordered by the king to help him buy a new throne.
No problem. However, we first need to tax you for your bank usage.
Wait... what?
Well it's only fair right? You tax us so we tax you.
On second thoughts... forget I said anything.
Mourners don't deal with taxes. Nice try.
Citizens don't deal with taxes. Nice try.
That should be enough people recruited, I'd better go and let Elena know.
Good work out there. You'd better speak to Elena and Councillor Halgrive, they'll go over the next steps with you.
Welcome back, and good work out there. Thanks to you we now have a force that can stand up to Lathas and his armies.
Now comes the difficult part though. Before we move against the king, we need to deal with his allies, the mourners.
How do we do that?
We now significantly outnumber the mourners, we should be able to drive them out of the city. The main focus will be their headquarters. Without their leadership, they'll soon retreat.
We have the numbers, but the mourners are better trained and better equipped. You should make sure you're ready before we begin. There will be bloodshed, on both sides.
Are you sure you're okay with this Elena?
I don't like it, but I know it's the only way. I appreciate the concern though, thank you friend.
It's necessary bloodshed though.
It is, it's just a shame there isn't another way.
A bit of blood doesn't scare me.
No... But you're not the one I'm worried about.
Are you ready to begin ?
I'm ready.
I will send word around to make sure our people are prepared. Good luck everyone.
This is it! The plague of West Ardougne has gone on for long enough, today is the day of plague's end!
I need to prepare.
Very well, return to us once you are ready.
Good work! Let's head downstairs and deal with the rest of them!
You! I knew you were trouble! Well don't worry, Lord Iorwerth will learn of your betrayal!
We did it! Now we'd better get out of here!
Excellent work with those mourners. I suspect the king might be getting a little worried now.
We'll need to move fast. He's probably already planning his retaliation.
He'll likely expect us to take some time to recuperate after that battle. He won't expect us to hit him right away.
So let me guess, that's exactly what we're going to do?
Indeed, we hit the castle now before they have a proper chance to prepare for us.
Even if they're not prepared, the castle will still be well defended.
Yes, but thanks to our victory in West Ardougne, some of the knights are starting to question their loyalties. I've taken advantage of this and made arrangements to ensure the gates are open to us.
Make no mistake, it will still be a tough fight, but it's a fight we should be able to win.
We can afford to take a little bit of time to ensure everyone has resupplied so feel free to come back later if you're not ready yet. Just don't take too long.
Let me know when you are ready to begin.
I never thought this day would come. We're finally going to deal with that traitor once and for all!
Let's show him what it means to cross the people of Ardougne!
Look's like that's the last of them! Good work everyone!
Look who we found hiding in a wardrobe.
So you're a coward as well as a traitor! What a pathetic excuse of a man you are.
You call me a traitor? I am your king! The traitors here are the ones standing before me.
Give it a rest, it's over. We know the truth.
And what truth might that be?
You let an enemy into our city and covered it up by lying to your people.
And I'm sure you'd never do something like that. Don't think I didn't hear about the lies you spread about me.
There's also your brother. Murdered on your orders.
You are aware that his killer stands with you, are you not?
is innocent in this. You manipulated them for your own gain.
Oh don't you go pretending they're innocent! They're nothing more than a mercenary. All they care about is the big pot of gold at the end.
They betrayed me! Before long, they'll betray you as well!
Liar!
Enough! You're finished Lathas. The people will decide your fate. I don't expect them to be kind.
, do you have any questions for the king before we take him away? I suspect you won't get another chance to ask them.
Why were you helping Lord Iorwerth?
My father, King Ulthas, once ruled over a united Kandarin. I was his eldest son, the kingdom was my birthright! But my fool of a father took that from me.
When King Arthur and his knights arrived in our lands, my father granted them the castle of Camelot, ousting the loyal subjects that previously lived there.
Not only that, but he also declared that the kingdom be jointly ruled by my brother and I, rather than giving it to me as he should have.
When I ascended to my half-throne, I promised myself that I would unite this kingdom again, no matter the cost.
That's why I made the deal with Lord Iorwerth. In return for access to West Ardougne, he agreed to help me kill my brother and drive out King Arthur.
Did you know what the mourners were doing?
In West Ardougne? They were searching for some sort of temple. According to Lord Iorwerth, the power there would be essential in summoning Zamorak, the Dark Lord.
So you knowingly allied with a group of Zamorakians?
Of course I did! I prayed to Saradomin that he would help unite my kingdom again. He chose not to reply. I turned to the Dark Lord instead.
With Zamorak at my side, nothing would stand between me and Camelot!
Why did you kill your brother?
Last I checked it was you that killed him, not me.
You know what I mean.
My brother was never meant to rule. The kingdom was mine by birthright! My father chose to give him half the kingdom, and he did a terrible job ruling it.
Have you seen West Ardougne? The city is a mess, and not because of the plague. That was my brother's doing. I may be a bad person, but make no mistake, my brother was no hero either.
We're done here, take him away.
Bring forth the condemned!
Citizens of Ardougne! Before you stands Lathas Ardignas: a traitor, a murderer and a liar!
He has been found guilty of numerous heinous crimes, and will now face judgement for his sins!
So this is it. After all this time, Lathas is finally going to pay for what he's done. It's like I should feel something, but I just feel empty.
Lathas Ardignas, as decided by the people of Ardougne, you are hereby sentenced to death!
Do you have any final words?
How dare you insult me like this! You can't kill me! I am the rightful king! Every person here is under my rule!
The people have passed their judgement, you are not a king any more.
Then you are all traitors, and you will all pay with your lives!
So be it...
In the name of Zamorak I curse you, each and every one of you!
Hello again.
Well hello again adventurer! How are you today?
Fine thank you. And yourself?
Not too bad, I've a lot to do though. King Lathas left plenty of things for us to clean up.
On behalf of everyone in Ardougne, I thank you for your help adventurer. I'm afraid I don't have time to talk, my predecessor has left me with a lot of work to do.
So you finally decided to show your true colours, how disappointing.
We should have killed them both when we had the chance.
Hmm, perhaps.
You know, after you killed King Tyras, I thought you might have some potential. Given time, we might have properly welcomed you into our ranks. You'd have been the first human among us.
Well I'm glad to have disappointed you. I don't work with murderers.
No? You seemed more than happy to kill King Tyras when it suited you. Burnt him alive in the middle of his own camp if I recall.
is innocent! You lied to them!
Lied? I told your friend here that King Tyras was an invader into our lands. Last time I checked, that was the truth.
Maybe, but you conveniently missed out the part about you trying to summon the Dark Lord.
Ah, I see you have been led astray. You think we are the evil ones, but our cause is the true one. You think we are murderers, but we are in fact saviours.
You think you're the hero of this story, but you're not...
You're mad!
Let me deal with them, my lord. They've caused us enough trouble.
They may still be of use to us. Lock them away for now. Give them time to think on their choices.
Hmm, as you wish.
That's enough Lord Iorwerth, let them go!
Brave of you to come here Arianwyn, but foolish. We have you outnumbered.
Don't be so sure. We fight with the strength of ten of your warriors.
Perhaps, but I don't believe you're the type to throw lives away without need. Instead, why don't we discuss this like reasonable people.
We don't have anything to discuss with you, you Zamorakian scum!
Zamorakian? You don't really think we'd support that monster do you? I'm afraid to say that you're quite mistaken.
Don't try to manipulate us with your lies. We know all about your plot with King Lathas to summon the Dark Lord.
Ah, that. Well now that King Lathas is dead, I suppose there's no better time to reveal the truth.
It was just a ruse I'm afraid. A lie we told King Lathas to get him on our side.
What are you on about?
We needed access to West Ardougne so we needed the support of the king. Once we found out about his hidden worship of Zamorak, it seemed like an obvious lie to tell.
I have no more love for Zamorak than you do. I've only ever served one god, the same one as you, Seren.
You're lying! You wanted to use the Temple of Light to summon Zamorak!
I can see why you'd think that, but you are mistaken. You're right to say that the temple is key to summoning a god, but that god is not Zamorak, it's Seren.
That's impossible! Seren is dead!
I thought the same once. That was until I managed to break one of the seals within the Grand Library.
That's how I discovered the truth. A part of Seren lives on, trapped within the Temple of Light.
I don't believe you!
A shame. You're better than this Arianwyn, I hope in time you will see that.
What should we do with them, my lord.
Let them go. Let it be known that the Iorwerth clan is not without mercy.
Are you sure about this?
Yes. But make no mistake Arianwyn, if you and your rebels interfere with our affairs again, I will not be so forgiving.
Now, I suggest you leave, before I change my mind.
This isn't over!
This is a bad idea.
Don't be so sure. They may not know it yet, but the rebels could be of great use to us...
Ah, there you are. We thought it best to let you rest for a bit after everything that happened earlier.
Thanks Arianwyn, I definitely needed it. And thank you for saving us back there, I don't know what we'd have done if you hadn't shown up.
I suspect you wouldn't have been around to have this conversation. You played a dangerous game in Ardougne. I fear you may not have considered the outcome of that.
People were dying Arianwyn, we couldn't do nothing.
Of course not, but we have no idea how Lord Iorwerth will respond to this. The things he said when we freed you were... concerning...
You can say that again. What do you think he meant by it all?
I'm not sure. It's something that we should discuss with the others.
Could you do me a favour and fetch Ysgawyn. He's probably on the upper platforms. You should bring your friend Elena as well. I'm not sure where she is I'm afraid, Ysgawyn might know though.
Are you Ysgawyn?
I am, what of it human?
Arianwyn has called a meeting. He asked me to come fetch you.
I see, so now I'm meant to follow the orders of a human.
It wasn't an order, it was just...
Make no mistake human, you may have Arianwyn and the others fooled but I know what you are.
I don't know what you mean...
You're a menace. You claim you're here to help, but everywhere you go you leave a trail of bodies behind.
Anyway, I'll come to this meeting, I'm in no place to deny Arianwyn. Just stay out of my way from here on out.
Fine. Before you go, do you know where Elena is?
The other human? I think she's by the pond to the south west. Now if you'll excuse me...
Well... he was nice.
Hey Elena.
Hey.
So how are you doing, Elena?
I'm okay. So much has happened so fast, it's a lot to take in.
It is. I'm here for you if you need me though.
Thanks, that means a lot.
You'll get used to it.
I guess... I just don't know if I want to.
Yeah, it's no small thing.
Anyway, I wanted to ask you something.
Go ahead.
The people of Ardougne, the elves here, you've spent a lot of time helping them. Why? What drives you, ?
I care about helping people.
So even if you knew that you'd get nothing out of it yourself, you'd still continue to help these elves?
Of course.
I suspect not many people would feel that way.
Well I'm not like other people.
Clearly. Thank you for answering, I realise it's a pretty pointless question. I was curious to know how you felt though.
Well a reward's always nice, but yes.
I guess it's always nice to be rewarded. It's good to know that isn't all that matters to you though. I suspect not many people would feel that way.
Actually, I think I'd want a reward.
I guess it's always nice to be rewarded. You should be careful not to let that drive you though. Money can't buy everything,.
Well I've rambled on enough. Was there something you needed?
Arianwyn has called a meeting. He'd like you to attend.
I'd better head over there then.
People reward me for helping them.
So if you didn't think you'd get a reward, you'd stop helping these elves?
Yes, the reward is what matters.
You should be careful of letting that drive you. Money can't buy everything,.
Actually, I think I'd still help.
So it's not just about the reward after all. It's nice to know that isn't all that matters to you. I suspect not many people would feel that way.
I need to fix my mistakes.
So it's about what happened with King Tyras? Do you think you'd still help these elves if that hadn't happened?
I think so.
So it's not just guilt that's driving you, that's good to know. What happened with King Tyras was awful but you can't take too much blame, Lathas manipulated you.
No, I don't think I would.
So the only thing driving you is guilt? That doesn't seem healthy. Be careful that you don't carry the world on your shoulders,. It's not your fault that Lathas manipulated you.
I'm not sure.
Hmmm, not something you've had to think about I guess. Just make sure that you don't carry the world on your shoulders,. It's not your fault that Lathas manipulated you.
I know, thanks Elena.
Anyway, I've rambled on enough. Was there something you needed?
I'd better head over there then. Thanks for the talk.
It's my duty to help people.
Be careful of hiding behind duty, it won't stop people holding you accountable for your actions.
Hmmm, not something you've had to think about I guess. It's worth considering though. We should all have something to drive us.
Anyway, was there something you needed?
Maybe later.
Fair enough. Was there something you needed?
Hey. You should talk to Arianwyn when you're ready to begin.
Hey, I wanted to ask you...
No. Go away and talk to Arianwyn instead.
Hey there. You should let Arianwyn know once you're ready to get started.
Hey there. Arianwyn's leading this meeting so you should let him know when you're ready to start.
Good to see you. You should speak to Arianwyn when you're ready to begin.
Right, now that we're all here, let's get started.
So, as I'm sure you've all heard, King Lathas of Ardougne is dead. He was overthrown by his subjects and executed soon afterwards.
That's not all though, the mourners of West Ardougne have been driven out of the city. Lord Iorwerth no longer has any presence in Ardougne.
Let's not ignore the obvious, Arianwyn. Our supposed ally, helped lead the uprising. His actions may well have endangered us all.
But surely this is a good thing? With Ardougne lost to him, Lord Iorwerth no longer has access to the Temple of Light. Without that, he has no way to summon the Dark Lord.
The temple was already secure. All this uprising has achieved is to anger the enemy.
You say that like it's a bad thing, Ysgawyn. Last time I checked, we didn't care about upsetting our foe.
I care about keeping our people alive, Islwyn!
And what about our people? While you sat here in your secure little village, we took action! We saved lives! But I guess you're too selfish to care about us.
Selfish? How dare you! You know nothing of the plight of the elves, girl. You'd do well to keep your mouth shut!
That's enough Ysgawyn. We can debate what's happened for days and still reach no conclusion. That is not why I called you all here. Instead, we need to plan what happens next.
Now, while freeing and Elena from the Iorwerth camp, we were confronted by Lord Iorwerth. He could have killed us all, but he let us go.
He let you go? Why?
His reasoning was disturbing. For a long time now, we've believed that Lord Iorwerth has been trying to summon Zamorak, the Dark Lord. However, he claimed otherwise.
But if not Zamorak, then who?
Seren.
Seren? But that's impossible, Seren is gone.

He seems to think otherwise. He claimed that a part of Seren still lives, trapped within the Temple of Light. Apparently, he discovered this by breaking one of the nine seals within the Grand Library.
That's impossible. He must be lying.
Sorry, but I don't understand what you mean by all of this. Who's Seren? What library?
Seren was our goddess, our guardian and our teacher. Everything we have, we owe to her. She helped us build the great city of Prifddinas, a place where all elves could live in harmony.

At the end of the God Wars, the gods were banished from this world. Seren didn't want to leave us though, she couldn't. She shattered herself into thousands of crystals. Those crystals are all we have left of her now.
I see, I'm sorry to hear that.
As for the Grand Library, it was a great archive of knowledge beneath Prifddinas. Pretty much everything there was open to all of elven kind.
There was an exception to that though, the nine seals of Seren. The seals guarded the forbidden knowledge, that which only Seren herself could access.
And Lord Iorwerth managed to break one of these seals.
So he claims...
Is there no way we can check?
No. Prifddinas was lost to us. When Lord Iorwerth first took control of the city, my grandfather, Baxtorian, led an army to try and stop him.
When that failed, Baxtorian and the other clan elders made one final ditch attempt to save Prifddinas. They sung the song of inversion to revert the entire city to a crystal seed.
Their plan worked, and the city was lost to Lord Iorwerth. However, it was lost to the rest of us as well, the Grand Library with it.
What happened to Baxtorian?
While he was fighting Lord Iorwerth, invaders took control of our kingdom to the east. They kidnapped Glarial, Baxtorian's wife.
Unable to find her, he sealed himself beneath the waterfall where they lived, never to be seen again.
Baxtorian was king of the elves back then. Do you think he had access to the forbidden knowledge?
It's not impossible I suppose. If anyone, it would have been him. Baxtorian was closer to Seren than any other elf, it's one of the reasons he was chosen to become king.
Baxtorian is gone though, even if he knew something, he can't help us now.

Don't be so sure. I never knew my grandfather, but my mother always told me that he wasn't the type for taking chances. If he knew something important, he'd have made sure it wouldn't have been lost with him.
We can't possibly make a plan without knowing Lord Iorwerth's intentions. While unlikely to be true, this stuff about the library is all we have to go on.
If Baxtorian left behind anything that could help us, we should try to find it.
Baxtorian kept everything of importance to him at his home within Baxtorian Falls. If we're going to find anything, it's probably there.
, you've been to Baxtorian Falls multiple times. You're the best person to take the lead on this.
You trust the human with this?
Let go of your pride, Ysgawyn. has proven his worth to us.
I'd like to accompany you on this one, it might be useful to have an elf with you.
Sounds good to me.
Before her death, my mother passed down a book to me. It was written by my grandfather for his wife. You should take it with you. It might contain something of use.
Thank you Islwyn. While we're gone, the rest of you should focus on Lord Iorwerth. See if you can get any idea on what he's planning now that he's lost Ardougne. Just be careful.
We always are. Good luck to you both.
And you. Let's get started.
Thank you for agreeing to help us,. We owe a lot to you, even if some of us don't show it very well.
You mean Ysgawyn? He is a bit rude.
Try not to be too judgemental. Ysgawyn's husband was killed by Essyllt, one of Lord Iorwerth's henchmen. Ysgawyn's never really been the same since.
I've met Essyllt, he was the one in charge of the mourners in West Ardougne.
He's a nasty piece of work. If you try hard enough, you can find something redeemable about most elves, even those that serve Lord Iorwerth.
But Essyllt... He seems to take joy in the suffering of others, especially those unable to defend themselves.
Enough about him though, we need to focus on Baxtorian Falls. I suggest we travel seperately, we can't be too careful at the moment.
Makes sense, will you be okay getting there on your own?
I'm no expert on your lands but I should be fine. I just have a few things to gather before I depart.
Well in that case, I'll meet you there.
I just have a few things to gather before I depart for Baxtorian Falls. I'll meet you there.
Sounds good, see you there.
Hey. Good to see you.
How are things going?
Pretty good. I've been thinking about that elf, Ysgawyn.
Bit of an angry guy isn't he?
That's one way to put it. I can't say I approve of his attitude, but I appreciate he's seen a lot in this war.
It's interesting, the elves have such long lifespans, we're just children compared to them. And yet, even with all their experience, they're still just as fickle as we are.
I find most races are the same to be honest.
Anyway, had any luck with Baxtorian Falls?
Not yet.
I'll let you crack on then. We'll talk more later.
No. Go away.
Hello there, glad to see you made it here okay.
You as well Arianwyn.
I must say, it feels strange to be back here, especially after all of this time.
You've been here before?
A long time ago...
I was one of the elves born in Baxtorian's new kingdom. My family were close relations of Baxtorian, he invited us here a few times.

Those were simpler times, happier times. After Baxtorian left to try and retake Prifddinas, my parents were among those who joined him. They never returned. I was still just a child at the time, alone and afraid.
I'm sorry to hear that Arianwyn.
This war has taken so much... From my people, and from yours. I'd give anything to see peace, anything to finally see Prifddinas with my own eyes.
Sorry, now's not the time for this. We need to see if Baxtorian left anything of use behind.
Here's that book that Islwyn gave us. Hopefully it has something of use in it.
Do you believe what Lord Iorwerth said about Seren?
To be honest... I really don't know. It seems impossible, and yet...
No. It's just me being wishful. He's lying, he has to be.
Wishful?
By the time I was born, Seren was already gone from this world. All I know of her is the stories my parents told me.
You wish you could have met her?
I do, but that doesn't mean I should fall for the lies of Lord Iorwerth. Seren is gone, nothing can ever bring her back.
Do you think we'll find anything to help us here?
I won't lie, we're clutching straws here. We have nothing else to go on though, so we have to try.
Baxtorian was once king of the elves, anything he left behind might be of use.
I'll crack on.
We need to see if Baxtorian left anything of use behind. Maybe that book will be of use.
Glarial! I... oh...
Who are you?
I'm and this is Arianwyn.
Arianwyn... I remember that name. You grew up in my kingdom... I'm sorry about your family.
Don't be your majesty...
I appreciate the sentiment, but please, I am no king anymore.
Now I must ask... Glarial... Is there any news?
I'm sorry but... she's gone.
I... I see... It was always a lot to hope for...
If it's any consolation, moved her remains here, to be closer to you.
That... That means a lot. Thank you. It is good to see that some humans still see elves as friends.
If you need time...
No... I feel I've spent long enough here.
Then I can take you back to Lletya. Your grandson, Islwyn, is there.
Grandson? So Eirlys had a child? Does she still live as well?
I'm afraid not... I'm sorry.
No father should outlive their child. Forgive me Eirlys.
Please, let us leave now. There is too much sadness for me here, too much pain. Once we arrive, you must tell me everything that has happened in my absence.
Very well, I will teleport us back to Lletya. You'll have to make your own way back I'm afraid,.
No problem. See you soon.
Oh... Hello there. You'd probably best talk to Arianwyn.
I'd like to ask you something about yourself.
I see... Go ahead.
Why did you seal yourself away?
My Glarial... She mattered more to me than anything else, but she was lost to me. The enemy took her, so I searched far and wide to find her again.
At times I came close, but in the end, I was too weak to carry on. I knew there was a chance she may live though, so I sealed myself away, hoping she would be the one to wake me.
I see. I'm sorry.
I thank you friend, but please, don't be. The burden is mine to bear.
What happened between you and Lord Iorwerth?
To be honest, even today I know little of him. When I left Prifddinas to expand our kingdom into the east, he was but a child, with the Iorwerth clan ruled by his mother.
The first time I properly met him was after I heard about his takeover of the city. I led my forces through the Underground Pass and confronted him at the city gates.
I tried to reason with him, but he had already decided that I was his enemy. We had the numbers and our forces were better skilled, so we tried to besiege the city.
The Iorwerth forces had the strength and safety of the city walls though. They slowly whittled us down until we were too weak to carry on. We had no choice but to retreat.
We fell back into the Underground Pass, intending to return to our kingdom in the east. Lord Iorwerth sent his forces in after us, hoping to wipe us out.
We no longer had the strength in numbers, but we still outmatched the Iorwerth troops in skill and experience. We fought back while we retreated. Both sides suffered huge losses.
Eventually we managed to make it through to the other side. By then, there were few of us left. Lord Iorwerth had failed to wipe us out, but he knew we were beaten.
While we were gone, an uprising had occurred in the eastern kingdom. We took our best fighters to Prifddinas, those that remained were unable to hold back the enemy.
My wife was taken and most of my people were slaughtered. I turned my attention to finding my wife and getting the rest of my people to safety.
Lord Iorwerth became the least of my problems. I suspect he didn't consider me much of a threat at that point anyway.
What was Seren like?
She... She was wonderful. She taught us to better ourselves in every way possible. Everything we know, everything we are, it all came from her.
I wish I could have met her.
I feel very blessed to have been able to. The love she had for us, it's unlike anything I've ever seen.
Sounds like she was pretty much perfect.
Well... not quite. Many of the elves alive now were not around when Seren was still with us. They only know her through the stories passed down to them. The stories don't tell everything though.
What do you mean?
Seren was remarkable, but under the surface, she hid a great pain. A sadness unlike any other. She never spoke of it, but when you looked hard enough, you could see the anguish.
I guess we all have our demons, even the gods. Seren was a beacon of light in this grim world, but the brightest light casts the darkest shadow, and none shone brighter than her.
What do you think of the current elves?

Arianwyn and the rebels have done well to keep going for this long. They've been fighting this war for centuries, and yet they've never given up. I have much respect for them, they're far stronger than I ever was.

Most of them are still young though. They lack the wisdom of the older elves, the ones who were around when Seren still walked this earth. Many of them never saw Prifddinas before the song of inversion.
Is that a bad thing?
Not necessarily, but it is something to be cautious of. That which they fight for, it's a mere dream to them. They should remember that dreams seldom come true.
I'll be back later.
I'd better be off.
Welcome back. While you were gone, I filled Baxtorian in on everything that has happened. I also took the liberty of calling the others here, so that we can discuss our next move.
You also missed out on Islwyn getting to meet his grandfather for the first time. I think he might have cried a little.
Cried? In your dreams Eluned.
I appreciate we're all happy to have Baxtorian back with us, but let's not get distracted.
Apologies, Arianwyn.
Right, over to you Baxtorian.
Thank you, Arianwyn. I... Forgive me, it's been a long time since I last chaired a meeting like this. Much has changed since then as well.
Take your time.
Thank you friend.
Arianwyn has informed me of Lord Iorwerth's revelation...
Do you believe his claims?
About Seren? No. As for him breaking a seal in the Grand Library... I... do not know.
You don't know? What do you mean you don't know?
Ysgawyn...
I know not what the seals hide. What I do know is that they could, in theory, be broken.
I was lucky enough to be trusted by Seren. She confided in me many times. She never told me what knowledge the seals guard, but she did tell me that they could be destroyed.
How?
I don't know exactly. She said that those who follow the light would be able to access her knowledge.
And that's it? This gives us nothing to go on.
Not nothing. We now know that the seals can be destroyed, which means Lord Iorwerth could have spoken the truth.
But without access to the Grand Library, we have no way to be sure.
Well... we might still have a way.
A way to access the library?
Yes... Prifddinas may have been reverted to seed, but it does still exist.
You're not suggesting we restore the city are you? Even if we could, Lord Iorwerth would instantly take it.
No. While Lord Iorwerth is at large, Prifddinas must remain as it is. However, there may be a way to still enter the city.
You don't mean entering the crystal do you?
That's not possible.
Actually, I think it would be possible. The crystal seed that contains Prifddinas, it's not the same as the seeds we use to form weapons and armour.
The seed contains Prifddinas, but the seed itself is not the city.
So it's like a box?
Exactly, and if we can enter the box...
We can enter Prifddinas!
That's the idea. It won't be straightforward though.
Is it ever?
We will need a special potion to be able to safely enter the crystal seed. We'll also need to be able to bypass the defences around it as well.
A potion? Sounds like my area of expertise.
Perfect. Elena, if you could help create this potion, that would be greatly appreciated. The rest of us can work on those defences.
Right., meet me by the pond. I could use your help with this.
Oh... Hello there.
What do I need to do now?
I've given Elena the information she needs to make that potion. You should speak to her by the pond.
Okay, will do.
Baxtorian has given Elena the information she needs to make this potion. You should speak to her by the pond.
Hi.
Hey. Glad everything went okay at Baxtorian Falls.
Thanks. Anything exciting happen while I was gone?
Nope, all nice and quiet for a change.
Good to hear.
Baxtorian is an interesting one, isn't he?
He does seem a bit...
Lost?
Exactly.
He reminds me of a story my father once told me. A story of a broken man.
What was the story?
A long time ago, there were two brothers living in Avarrocka. They lived a simple life, farming the land and selling the produce to people in the city.
When war came to the city, the king ordered that every able-bodied man take up arms against the enemy. The two brothers had to leave their home behind, to fight for a king they'd never met.
Like everyone else, they were given basic weapons and basic training. Enough to give them a chance, but not a big one. When the fighting started, they were poorly equipped and poorly prepared.

They fought in many battles. Battles in strange places against strange people. As the war dragged on, they saw more and more horrors, from both sides. The only thing that kept them going was each other.
As the war drew to a close, they were called to one final battle. The enemy knew they were losing, and they fought more ferociously than ever before.
That was where it happened. One of the brothers was cut off and surrounded. He tried to fight back, but he didn't stand a chance.
Eventually the fighting stopped, and the war was over. The other brother could finally go home. But the truth is, he had nothing to go home to.
It wasn't the farm that mattered, not really. The thing that mattered to him was gone.
In a way, he'd died back on the battlefield alongside his brother. Left in his place was just a broken man, with nothing left to live for.
Hmm. And you think Baxtorian is like this broken man?
He lost his wife, his people and his kingdom. Now he's in a strange place, surrounded by strange people, helping to fight a war that he lost a long time ago.
Now's not the time for stories, Elena.
I guess you're right. The short of it is, Baxtorian has lost everything that he cared about. He's just an empty shell now, with nothing left to live for.
Maybe he's not totally lost. He still has Islwyn, and we can still turn this war around.
Maybe. I guess only time will tell.
Right. Shall we get started with this potion?
What do we need?
Baxtorian gave me the details. To start with, we need an elder cadantine herb. We should be able to grow one from a normal cadantine seed, we just need to prepare the patch a little differently.
The elves have said we can use this farming patch here. While I prepare the patch, could you go and fetch a cadantine seed and a seed dibber?
I already have the seed here.
Well it also happens that I've actually already prepared the patch, so you can get started right away.
How convenient.
Indeed. When you're ready, go ahead and plant the seed.
Will do, I'll be back soon.
Hey. Do you have that seed yet?
It's a cadantine seed that we need. Let me know once you have one. You'll want to get a seed dibber as well so we can plant it.
I have one here.
Great. The patch is all prepared so just plant it when you're ready.
That's the seed planted.
Great. I'll keep an eye on the patch while it grows. You should check in with Arianwyn and Baxtorian in the meantime.
Okay, see you later.
Hey there.
Hello, how's the potion going?
We've planted the herb we need, now we have to wait for it to grow. Is there something I can do in the meantime?
I suspect there is. Myself and Baxtorian have been looking over how we can get past the defences around the crystal seed.
What defences are there?
The crystal seed containing Prifddinas, it lies in the middle of the clearing where the city once stood. The only thing left of the city itself are the walls.
These are no ordinary walls though. Long ago, they were reinforced by various enchantments to protect Prifddinas during the God Wars.
With Prifddinas gone, Lord Iorwerth has claimed the land where it once was. He's managed to manipulate the defences to only allow his allies to enter.
So how do we get past them?
While the Iorwerth clan may hold some magical knowledge... they are not mystics. I have no doubt that their work was crude at best, work that a true master of the magical arts could overcome.
I see. And where do we find a true master of the magical arts?
There were eight separate elven clans that journeyed with Seren to this world. Those eight clans still exist today, with each elf born into one of them.
You'll have already heard of some of the clans. The Iorwerth clan is known to you, the traitorous clan of assassins and slayers.
And the Cadarn clan of course, the warrior clan of which myself and Arianwyn are part of.
The other clans you might be less familiar with. However, one of those clans is key here, the Amlodd clan, the clan of mystics.
It was the Amlodd clan who created the Prifddinas defences. Their clan should have the knowledge needed to overcome them. And of all the Amlodd clan, none know more than Lord Ieuan Amlodd himself.
And where do we find him?
After Prifddinas was reverted to seed, the clan elders went into hiding. Before we parted ways, the others did leave me with some clues on how to find them.
Lord Amlodd may be our priority, but the other elders could be of great help in our fight against Lord Iorwerth. We should try and find them all.
I've managed to decipher the clue left behind by Lord Amlodd. We should be able to use it to find him. I've also started work on the other clues.
Apart from Lord Amlodd, I've only been able to decipher Lady Trahaearn's clue so far. I'll keep working on the others though.
, myself and Baxtorian will continue to work on deciphering these clues. While we do, it would be of great help if you could find Lord Amlodd and Lady Trahaearn for us.
How do I find Lord Amlodd?
Here is the clue he left behind: 'The elven crystal will lead you to me.'
I see, anything else I should know?
The Amlodd clan is a clan of mystics. Some sort of magic may be key to finding Lord Amlodd. You might also find this of use, Lord Amlodd gave it to me before we went our seperate ways.
How do I find Lady Trahaearn?
Here is the clue she left behind: 'I will journey south from the well.'
The Trahaearn clan is a clan of smiths and miners. It's possible that you'll need to use your smithing and mining skills to find Lady Trahaearn.
Okay, I'll get started.
We need you to find Lord Amlodd and Lady Trahaearn for us. Speak to Baxtorian, he can tell you about the clues they left behind.
Hello.
Hello again, how is it going?
Not bad, thank you.
It's good to have you helping us. We're all very grateful.
I have a seed from Baxtorian that I think needs enchanting.
Okay, let me see what I can do with it.
There you go. Be careful with it, I'm not sure what it will do when used.
Thanks for the warning, see you later.
It's the least I can do. I'll see you later.
Look at this place... It's beautiful, is it not?
Are you Lord Amlodd?
Amlodd? A curious name... Why do you ask?
Baxtorian sent me. He gave me a crystal that belonged to Lord Amlodd. It brought me here, to you.
To me? I see...
I have a question for you. This valley before us, how would you describe it?
Beautiful.
Yes... It's nice to look upon such beauty, it reminds me of my home. The crystal spires of Prifddinas.
Dangerous.
Yes... This world... it's so peaceful, so beautiful. But there is still danger here. It takes me back to the forests near my home, before Lord Iorwerth brought a different danger upon us.
Peaceful.
Yes... It is a welcome break from the wars of my home, the wars of Lord Iorwerth.
Boring.
I suppose it can seem that way. Little to see and little to do. But there is beauty in that simplicity, much like the forest of Isafdar.
I don't know.

The answers are not always easy to find. I have had time to reflect here, to consider this world. Maybe you need more time to find your own answer. Alas, it is time we do not have, for Lord Iorwerth awaits.
So you are Lord Amlodd?
Indeed, and if Baxtorian sent you, then it is time for me to leave this place. Tell me human, where must I travel to?
The village of Lletya, in the forest of Isafdar.
Then we shall leave at once. Allow me to teleport you back with me.
The rebels have created a wonderful village here. A safe refuge from the tyranny of Lord Iorwerth. Curious how something so beautiful could be born of something so terrible.
They've done well to keep up the fight for this long.
They have, but I'd expect no less of them. The song of the elves has been sung for thousands of years, it will continue for thousands more.
However, I fear that this verse is the darkest yet.
Who has awoken me? A human? You are not who I expected.
Baxtorian sent me. We need your help in the fight against Lord Iorwerth.
Baxtorian lives? And he is working with a human? This is most irregular. I see you repaired my exoskeleton as well. Impressive work for a human, but again, most irregular.
Tell me human, where is Baxtorian?
He's in the elven village of Lletya, south of here.
Then I will journey there at once. There is clearly a lot I need to catch up on.
These rebels had better get a move on and defeat Lord Iorwerth. Old ladies like me have a tendency to drop dead, and I'll be very annoyed if that happens before I see Prifddinas again.
How can you be annoyed if you're dead?
Oh I'll cook up quite the storm in the afterlife, believe me.
Good job finding Lord Amlodd and Lady Trahaearn. Now, you should probably go see how that seed you planted is doing.
Good idea, I'll go see Elena.
Oh... Hello there. Thank you for finding Lord Amlodd and Lady Trahaearn.
My pleasure.
Have you checked in with Elena recently? That seed has probably grown by now.
I'll go talk to her.
Hey. The elder cadantine herb grew perfectly. Let's get it harvested.
So what else do we need for the potion?
The other ingredient is crystal dust. Hopefully you can get some from Arianwyn or Baxtorian. Once you've got some dust, just add it to a vial of water along with the herb.
Right, I'll go see if I can get some crystal dust.
Don't forget this.
Hey Elena, what do I need to do again?
Add the elder cadantine to a vial of water and then add some crystal dust. Hopefully either Arianwyn or Baxtorian can give you some crystal dust.
Okay, thanks.
Oh... Hello. Do you need something?
I need some crystal dust for this potion I'm making.
Ah yes... I don't have anything you can use I'm afraid. Maybe Arianwyn can help you.
Hello. How's it going?
I'm working on getting that potion made. I need some crystal dust for it though.
Crystal dust? Interesting. Well I have an old crystal here that you can use. It will need grinding up though.
Why don't you try using that crystal I gave you?
Hey Elena, I've finished the potion.
Great, you should take it to Arianwyn and Baxtorian.
I've finished the potion.
Oh... You should give it to Arianwyn then.
I should probably take this to Arianwyn and Baxtorian rather than drinking it.
Great, I'll look after it for you. Now, let's call the others and discuss our plan for the Grand Library.
Right, thanks to, we should now have everything we need to enter the crystal seed containing Prifddinas.
So we have a way to bypass the defences?
Indeed we do. Baxtorian's knowledge allowed to reunite us with Lord Amlodd and Lady Trahaearn. It was the Amlodd clan that created those defences, Lord Amlodd can overcome them for us.
My magic can be used to teleport someone through the defences and into the crystal. It will require great focus though, I will only be able to send one of you in.
The inversion potion will ensure that whoever is sent survives the journey, now we just need to decide who that is.
I propose we send in. They have proven to us time and time again that they have the skill needed for a challenge like this.
You cannot be serious? Even if has proven their worth as you claim, which I have my doubts about, they'll never be deemed worthy enough to unlock Seren's hidden knowledge.
Why? Because they're not an elf?
Exactly! If Seren created a way for the seals to be destroyed, she would have made it so that only an elf could break them.
Were you there when Seren made those seals, boy?
I... Well of course not.
Then how do you know what our goddess intended?
I just think...
I don't know this human here, but I damn well don't know you either. The human was capable enough to find me and fix my exoskeleton. Maybe they are capable of this as well.
Then I propose that be the one sent into the crystal. Anyone disagree?
Yes we already know you do Ysgawyn. Anyone else?
Right, talk to Lord Amlodd when you are ready. Good luck.
I... Hello. You should probably talk to Lord Amlodd.
Good luck in the library,. We're all counting on you. Speak to Lord Amlodd when you're ready.
Hey Good luck in the library. We'll talk more when you get back.
The Grand Library of Prifddinas, such a beautiful place. You will be the first to step foot there for hundreds of years.
What do I need to do once I arrive?
They say Lord Iorwerth broke one of the nine seals of Seren within the library. Find this seal, and see what knowledge he uncovered.
Once that is done, seek out the other eight seals, see if you can break them as well. Their knowledge may be key to our fight against the darkness.
Do you have any idea how to break the seals?
According to Baxtorian, Seren herself said that those who follow the light will be able to access her knowledge.
That doesn't give me a lot to go on.
No, but it is all you have. Now, when you are ready, I can teleport you into the crystal seed. I have the potion that you made earlier, it will ensure you survive the journey.
One last thing, the laws that this land abide by, they may not apply in the library.
What does that mean?
The library has been reverted to crystal. That which is impossible out here, may well be normal in an environment like that. You should be cautious.
Now, are you ready?
Let's do this.
Very well. Good luck.
Let me go and prepare first.
As you wish.
Do you wish to return to the Grand Library?
Not right now.
And so comes another, to seek the knowledge of Seren. Greetings mortal.
You... You're Seren?
No... I'm just a memory. A mere fragment of something far greater. A guardian of the knowledge that she left behind.
I seek that knowledge, to help in the fight against Lord Iorwerth.
It is not my place to question why. I only exist to pass on that which she sealed away.
So you'll give me the knowledge?
The seals guard the truth. This seal has been broken, its knowledge is now open to all. Here is what you seek:
'...Therein lies my guilt. A part of me, trapped and alone. Dark, yes, but still a part of my being, sealed away in the Temple of Light.'

'The protections on the temple, they should keep her contained. But in case they don't, I created one last safeguard, a prison within a prison. With it I made a key, an orb of light, to unlock the darkness.'
'I could have destroyed it, sealed her away forever. But I still question my decision, and so I hid the orb away, while I think upon my choices.'
'The shrine at Gorlah, that is where it lies. With it, she can be freed... or destroyed...'
And so ends the knowledge of this seal.
So Lord Iorwerth spoke the truth. A part of Seren lives within the Temple of Light. But why?
I have imparted the knowledge of this seal. There is nothing more here to give. If you seek the rest, then the other seals must be broken.
Start with the Seal of Ithell, to the south east. The light will guide the way...
The seeker of knowledge returns. Do you wish to hear the knowledge again?
Yes please.
Here is what you seek:
If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Ithell. You'll find it on the middle level, to the south east. The light will guide the way...
No thanks.
Then I have nothing more to give. If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Ithell. You'll find it on the middle level, to the south east. The light will guide the way...
'When I first encountered the elves on their homeworld of Tarddiad, it was like I had finally found my purpose. I quickly fell in love with them, and they with me.'
'I set out to help them, to guide them. They immediately embraced this, and one of their mystics, Ceidwad, documented my teachings in a great book called the Cerddi.'
'It was the start of something beautiful, but there is pain in beauty, as I soon came to realise...'
If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Cadarn. You'll find it on the bottom level, to the south. The light will guide the way...
If you wish, I can return you to the central chamber.
Could you teleport me somewhere?
Where would you like to go?
I can only take you to a seal which has already been broken.
Then I have nothing more to give. If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Cadarn. You'll find it on the bottom level, to the south. The light will guide the way...
'...Compared to many of the mortal races I had encountered, the elves had reasonable lifespans. And yet, it wasn't long enough.'
'As I spent time with the elves, I watched as they withered and died. Each death was a blade through my heart, but none more so than Ceidwad, my closest companion.'
'It didn't seem fair, didn't seem right. They deserved more. I knew I had to give it to them...'
If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Crwys. You'll find it on the middle level, to the north west. The light will guide the way...
Then I have nothing more to give. If you seek more of the knowledge, look to the Seal of Crwys. You'll find it on the middle level, to the north west. The light will guide the way...
'...I found a way to share my essence with the elves, a piece of my being for each one of them.'
'With this gift, their years would number in the thousands, time enough to live the lives they deserved.'
